frame.name: Affirm_or_deny
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a <fen>Message</fen> to some <fen>Addressee</fen>. Instead of (or in addition to) a <fen>Speaker</fen>, a <fen>Medium</fen> may also be mentioned. Likewise, a <fen>Topic</fen> may be stated instead of a <fen>Message</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">She</fex> <t>affirmed</t> <fex name="Message">her loyalty to the cause</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">He</fex> <t>denied</t> <fex name="Message">that he had ever believed in the existence of God</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Med">BBC News</fex> <t>confirmed</t> <fex name="Top">the story about the refugees</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity affirming or denying the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> (this can be spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of the predicative uses of the target word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
<ex>No one believed <fex name="Spkr">Evelyn</fex>'s <t>affirmation</t> that she could speak to ghosts.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Spkr">Evelyn</fex> <t>conceded</t> that the ghosts were actually just imaginary friends.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Message</fen> identifies the content whose truth the <fen>Speaker</fen> is affirming or denying. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
<ex>They <t>refute</t> the criticisms <fex name="Msg">that they are only interested in power and money</fex>.</ex>
<ex>On Monday my boss <t>confirmed</t> <fex name="Msg">that I was indeed promoted</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Addressee</fen> is the person to whom the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Place</fen> specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Manner</fen> describes the way in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> affirms or denies a <fen>Message</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Iterations
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Iterations</fen> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Means</fen> expresses the act whereby the <fen>Speaker</fen> affirms or denies a <fen>Message</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Speaker</fen> while he/she affirms or denies the <fen>Message</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Degree</fen> selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it. </def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies an event during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> affirms or denies the truth of the <fen>Message</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>In general, <fen>Event_description</fen> is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole - here, the <fen>Message</fen> event. </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Frequency</fen> is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. </def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The emotional or physical state of the <fen>Speaker</fen> that leads to their affirmation or denial of the <fen>Message</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is rarely mentioned in constructions with verbal targets, and is much more common with nominal targets, where it is usually expressed as a PP Complement headed by "of" or about".</def-root>

lexUnit.name: concede.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to finally admit or agree that something is true

lexUnit.name: deny.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to claim that something is false

lexUnit.name: affirm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to state or assert positively; to maintain as true

lexUnit.name: affirmation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act or instance of affirming (declaring to be true)

lexUnit.name: confirm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to establish the truth, accuracy, or validity of something

lexUnit.name: confirmation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act or instance of confirming

lexUnit.name: denial.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act or instance of denying

lexUnit.name: reaffirm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to affirm again; to state again as true/a fact

lexUnit.name: refute.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to prove (a statement, accusation, opinion) to be false or erroneous

lexUnit.name: attest.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to declare to be correct, true, or genuine
